result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cameron Sentrez Flowers

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cameron Sentrez Flowers in court, in custody.  Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court for Cameron Sentrez Flowers.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a final pretrial. Defense is requesting to conduct a plea hearing today. Case is passed to 1:30 PM.

***
Recalled at 1:53 PM. Appearances are the same. Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1 of the amended information.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Court vacates jury trial dates. Court adjourns sentencing and orders a TAD evaluation to be completed. Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Cameron Sentrez Flowers in court, in custody.  Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court for Cameron Sentrez Flowers.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a final pre-trial.  Parties inform the court of ongoing negotiations and possible resolution.  Court scheduled an adjourned final pre-trial/projected guilty plea.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed: State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed: State's Requested Jury Instructions

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court, defendant Cameron Sentrez Flowers not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Case called with co-defendant FLOWERS 22CF1672. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. Case set for final pretrial and Jury Trial.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court, defendant Cameron Sentrez Flowers not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Case called with co-defendant FLOWERS 22CF1672. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Cameron Sentrez Flowers in court with Attorney Douglas E. Batt; both appear by video.  William Berens appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Detective L. Binter. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered no contact with Kwik-Trip -West Allis, Michael W.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $10,000.00 .  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. No Contact order monitoring only.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Cameron Sentrez Flowers in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Cameron Sentrez Flowers in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
